intro: Euphorbia louwii, commonly known as the Louw's spurge, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, green stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has a shallow root system and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun exposure. Euphorbia louwii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid environments.
